intro: Oreocome elata, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Oreocome elata produces showy yellow or white flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
